name: The Nasty Bits: Lamb's Neck Stew
description: Note: Our intern Chichi Wang loves offal so much, she pitched us this series called The Nasty Bits, where she'll explore recipes involving animal innards on a regular basis. Her goal is to tempt Serious Eaters out of their safety...
recipeIngredient: approximately 3 cups water, low sodium chicken broth, or dry white wine
7 to 8 sprigs of fresh thyme, or rosemary
1 teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Add olive oil to the pan and set over medium-high heat, heating oil until it is near smoking. Add the pieces of neck, in batches if necessary to avoid crowding. Once the lamb is browned, removed to plate.
When you have finished browning all the lamb, place the pieces in a pot and pour wine, stock or water to cover the meat three-quarters of the way. Add the lemon juice and thyme. Add salt.
Simmer for approximately one hour, until the lamb is tender. Removed herbs and discard. Serve lamb in soup bowls with the broth, accompanied by a good crusty loaf.
